Excitations of the Electron Gas

  • An exciton is a bound electron-hole pair in a sea of other electrons.
  • Plasmons are longitudinal charge density oscillations induced by the Coulomb interactions between electrons.
  • Response theory describes the response of a system to stimuli, such as a perturbing electromagnetic field, which may then generate excitations.

Response Theory

  • For weak perturbations, a linear response theory may be used, otherwise non-linear response theory is required.
  • The linear response of a dynamical system property Ψ\PsiΨ﻿ to a perturbing force F⃗\vec FF﻿ is
  • Here, the (real) dynamic response function (susceptibility) χi,j(x⃗,x⃗′,t,t′)\chi_{i,j}(\vec x, \vec x', t, t')χi,j​(x,x′,t,t′)﻿ describes the response of the field component Ψi\Psi_iΨi​﻿ at location x⃗\vec xx﻿ and time ttt﻿ to a perturbing force applied at x⃗′\vec x'x′﻿ at earlier time t′t't′﻿.
    • By causality,
    • If the system is translationally invariant then χi,j\chi_{i,j}χi,j​﻿ depends only on the relative coordinate x⃗−x⃗’\vec x-\vec x’x−x’﻿. If also in an equilibrium state, then it will depend only on the relative time t−t’t-t’t−t’﻿.

    • These oscillations are called Friedel oscillations. Analogous oscillations in spin density occur around a magnetic moment, giving RKKY exchange coupling between magnetic ions.
  • In 1D, the dielectric function diverges, implying the metallic state is unstable (Peirels transition).

Correlation Functions

  • The density correlation function is
  • The density fluctuation correlation function is
  • These describe the correlation between the charge density of a system at one location and time with that at another location and time.
    • Hence, in a crystal there is a peak if x−x’x-x’x−x’﻿ is a direct lattice vector.
  • The structure factor is the Fourier transform in both space and time of the density correlation function;
    • With a huge amount of work, it can be shown that the structure factor is proportional to the cross section for the scattering of an incoming particle with k⃗\vec kk﻿ and Ek⃗E_{\vec k}Ek​﻿ into an outgoing particle with k⃗’=k⃗+q⃗\vec k’=\vec k +\vec qk’=k+q​﻿ and energy Ek⃗=Ek⃗+ℏωE_{\vec k}=E_{\vec k}+\hbar \omegaEk​=Ek​+ℏω﻿;
    • This is a realisation of the fluctuation-dissipation theorem.
  • Using linear response theory, it can be shown that the density fluctuation correlation function SρS_\rhoSρ​﻿ of an electron gas is related to the dissipation in the electron gas χ2\chi_2χ2​﻿ by the fluctuation dissipation theorem;
  • Relationships between response functions, energy loss and structure factors are generally valid for any response function irrespective of whether interactions are present or not.
    • The density response functions are often relatively easy to probe, giving good experimental insight.
